meta.title: SafeSail – Intelligent Marine Conditions & Decision-Support Platform
meta.shortDescription: A full-stack, AI-assisted mobile application that helps sea-goers make safer decisions based on real-time marine and weather data.

content.title: Overview
body: SafeSail is a full-stack, AI-assisted mobile application designed to help boat owners, sailors, surfers, and sea-goers make safer and smarter decisions before going out to sea.
The core goal of the system is to transform complex marine and weather data into a clear, actionable recommendation — answering a simple but critical question:
“Is it a good day to go out to sea for my specific vessel type?”
SafeSail combines real-time marine data, atmospheric weather forecasts, vessel-specific safety rules, and time-based sea condition insights.

sections.subtitle: Intelligent Sea Condition Scoring
body: Each time window receives a composite sea condition score.
bodyEnd: The score is mapped to a clear recommendation: Not Recommended, Moderate, or Recommended.

sections.subtitle: Vessel- & Location-Aware Scoring
body: Sea condition scoring is dynamically adjusted by location and vessel type, ensuring that forecasts reflect local marine characteristics and the operational limits of:

sections.subtitle: Daily Overview
items: Morning, Noon, and Evening large time blocks
Instant “go / no-go” understanding for the entire day
Automatic highlighting of the best time window

sections.subtitle: Detailed Intraday Breakdown
items: Detailed wind, wave, and swell values
Visual trend graphs for wind speed and wave height

content.title: Personalized Experience
bullets: Users select a preferred beach or location
Users choose a vessel type, which directly affects scoring logic
All recommendations adapt automatically to user preferences

content.title: Internationalization & RTL / LTR Support
body: Full bilingual support for Hebrew and English.
Automatic RTL and LTR layout switching based on the selected language.
Localized text, navigation flow, icons, charts, and alignment.
Designed to feel native in both left-to-right and right-to-left environments.
bullets: Attention to detail beyond “just translating strings”

content.title: Smart Notifications
bullets: Users receive notifications when their preferred beach has ideal conditions
Notifications are sent when conditions align with the user’s selected vessel’s optimal ranges

sections.subtitle: User Authentication
items: Token-based authorization between frontend and backend

content.title: Admin Dashboard & Internal Tools
body: SafeSail includes internal admin capabilities, built for maintainability and future scaling:
bullets: Manage beaches including coordinates, regions, and activation
Manage vessel types and scoring thresholds
Inspect forecast data per location and timeframe

content.title: Backend Architecture
body: The backend is designed for scalability, clarity, and automation.

sections.subtitle: Data Ingestion Pipeline
items: Normalization and merging of data into a unified forecast model
Automatic generation of timeframes and daily blocks

sections.subtitle: AI-Assisted Scoring System
body: The scoring system is rule-based and explainable.
Vessel-specific optimal ranges are defined in structured tables.
The system produces deterministic and transparent results.

sections.subtitle: Frontend
items: Optimized for outdoor and marine use cases
Charts and visual indicators for quick readability

content.title: Why This Project Matters
body: SafeSail is not just a weather app — it is a decision-support system.
bullets: Full-stack ownership from UX to data pipelines
Deterministic AI logic for safety-critical domains
bodyEnd: This project reflects my ability to design and build end-to-end systems, translate real-world problems into scalable software, combine UX, backend architecture, data modeling, and automation, and own a product from idea to production to app store review.
SafeSail represents how I approach software: clear intent, strong architecture, and real user value.
